DOC.detailed_description: Obesity risk factor migraine . Further , past decade multiple line research substantiate presence migraine headache risk factor CVD ( eg . stroke ) . Migraineurs also demonstrate abnormal insulin response , high lipid endothelial dysfunction . Limited data suggests low fat diet may benefit reduce migraine frequency ; study examine efficacy low carbohydrate ( ie . low glycemic ) diet migraine prevention adults.. None study examine effect potential mechanism diet program CV health , body composition , inflammatory cascade migraineurs . This 3 -month study address efficacy potential mechanism two different diet , ( low carbohydrate diet low fat diet ) migraine prevention clinical cohort overweight obese person migraine . The overall aim test hypothesis behavioral intervention improve migraine frequency improvement associate favorable change body composition , inflammation , CV parameter . Hypothesis 1.1 The mean monthly migraine frequency decrease maintain low-fat diet low-carbohydrate diet 3 month compare control . Hypothesis 1.2 Participants randomize diet demonstrate favorable change body composition ( eg . decrease adipose tissue volume magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) body fat DEXA ) , inflammatory marker ( eg . decrease adipocytokine level ) , CV parameter ( eg . improve cholesterol panel , glucose level marker arterial stiffness ) compare control .
DOC.criteria: overweight obese ( BMI 25 42 ) woman > 18 year < 50 year old Migraine meeting ICHD criterion least 6 month prior screen headache frequency document > 2 < 10 headache day per month BP inclusion criterion SBP < 160 DBP < 100 mm Hg hypocaloric diet ( must weight stable prior 3 month ) Selfreport alcohol substance abuse past year current treatment Type 1 2 diabetes
